III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth went to the ER for self-harming. The youth presented with
sores and bruising all over their body. Unknown where the bruises
came from.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via email on June 4, 2025.
Complainant said they have no additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
29, 2025. Youth A said he has no concerns about Mott Children’s
Residence and feels safe at the facility. Youth A denied being in
any restraint or any staff physically touching him in any way.
Youth A denied staff being harmful to him in any way. Youth A
said he meets weekly with Therapist and feels comfortable talking
with her about his needs. Youth A said he has all of his needs
being met.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
29, 2025. Youth B said he was on the same unit at Youth A. Youth
B said he has never seen Youth A being restrained. Youth B said
he has never seen or heard of staff harming Youth A in any
manner. Youth B said Youth A “hurts himself by cutting and
chewing on glass”. Youth B said he does not have any concerns
about staff or his safety.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 29,
2025. Nurse said she reviewed Youth A’s medical file and there is
nothing noting he bruises easily. Nurse said Youth A has been
seen by an endocrinologist to rule out any medical issues that
would cause him to bruise. Nurse said Youth A has seen her and
several other doctors since his placement and has never reported
any abuse or concerning interactions by staff. Nurse said Youth A
does inflict self-harm and has cut himself and swallowed glass so
the bruises may be from his actions. Nurse said she has not seen
or heard of any staff being physically aggressive with Youth A.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May
29, 2025. Therapist said she works weekly with Youth A and is still
working on building a therapeutic relationship with him as he has
only been placed at Mott Children’s Residence since May 8, 2025.
Therapist said Youth A struggles with self-harm behaviors, and he
has cut himself, swallowed glass, and has several superficial
scratches on his arms. Therapist said Youth A has been brought
into the hospital on several occasions due to his self-harming.
Therapist said Youth A has very impulsive behaviors and will pull
2

his hair out when anxious causing patches of hair missing on his
head. Therapist said Youth A has also run away several times and
will run through the woods and come back with bruises and
scratches. Therapist said Youth A is currently taking medications
for a thyroid issue and seeing a specialist to address any issues
that may be causing. Therapist said Youth A has never reported
any staff being aggressive with him. Therapist said she has not
seen nor heard of any staff harming Youth A in any manner.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated May 21, 2025, regarding an AWOL of
Youth A resulting in him being brought to the hospital for an
evaluation upon his return.
• Youth A’s Medical Record was reviewed:
o May 22, 2025, at Genesee Health System for a
Behavioral Assessment, Youth A refused to speak
and refused all services.
o May 23, 2025, at Hurley Pediatric Endocrinology
Clinic for Abnormal thyroid function testing, Youth A
was prescribed Synthroid.
o May 16, 2025, at McLaren Flint Emergency
Department for Swallowed Foreign Body. Youth A
was treated for swallowing glass shards.
o May 21, 2025, at Mott Children’s Health Center for a
well child exam. Youth A presented with “bruises on
arms bilaterally, cuts/scratches on left arm”. The
report stated “Bruises easily, LAB: Iron and Total
Iron Binding Capacity, LAB: CBC. Patent reports
scratches from self-harm, encouraged to follow up
with psychiatrist”.
• Youth A’s intake picture was viewed. Youth A presented
with visible scars or bruises on left arm.
• Nursing Notes for Youth A from Mott Children’s Residence:
o May 8, 2025, contact with DHHS Worker for
medications.
o May 8, 2025, initial medical exam which noted
“several marks on his right and left arm from SIB to
himself” as well as “a lot of bald spots on his head
from pulling his hair”.
o May 9, 2025, contact with MDHHS Worker regarding
medications.
o May 14, 2025, Youth A was seen by nurse for a
bloody nose, it was evaluated and determined it was
due to dryness.
3

o May 16, 2025, Youth A was seen due to blood on his
arms, face and mouth, stating he was chewing on
glass he found outside, sent to ER for examination.
o May 17, 2025, nurse reviewed the documentation
from McLaren ER visit, scheduled a follow up visit
with PCP.
o May 21, 2025, reviewed the PCP documentation for
Youth A.
o May 22, 2025, set up evaluation at Genesee Health
System for evaluation.
o May 23, 2025, reviewed documentation from
Genesee Health System appointment.
o May 23, 2025, Youth A was seen to evaluate current
bruising. Youth A refused to say how he got his
bruises.
o June 2, 2025, Youth A was seen due to an injury to
his elbow. Youth A refused to say how it occurred or
allow the nurse to take a picture.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and documentation reviewed, there is no evidence to
support Youth A’s bruises are caused by anyone at the agency or
due to a lack of supervision by staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
